channels.summary: Active sharing of articles and programmes on OSINT, AI’s impact on research data, and academic initiatives related to open-source justice and political science.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute article on OSINT in the Israel–Gaza war
highlights.details: Article from the Reuters Institute reflecting on how the Israel–Hamas/Israel–Gaza war showcases both the power and limits of open-source reporting, useful as a teaching text in journalism and OSINT courses.

highlights.title: AI agent that evades online survey detection
highlights.details: 404 Media piece on a research project where an AI agent was able to complete and evade detection in online surveys 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about bots poisoning social science survey data.

highlights.title: Utrecht Open-Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: University of Utrecht lab site describing projects that use open-source methods to investigate questions of global justice and accountability, relevant for students and researchers interested in OSINT and human rights.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast GLAN programme
highlights.details: Announcement of a Queen’s University Belfast law programme page (linked with GLAN) focusing on global legal action and open-source-based accountability, useful for those seeking academic or training opportunities in this space.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat RSS feed
highlights.details: RSS feed for the Bellingcat Stage Talk series, enabling academics and students to subscribe and use talks as teaching material or case studies.

highlights.title: Articles on death voyeurism and visual ethics
highlights.details: A New York Times opinion piece and a Guardian article on World Press Photo exploring the ethics of ‘moment of death’ imagery and death voyeurism, relevant for academic discussion in media, ethics and journalism courses.

highlights.title: Terry Tao on reported suspension of his research at UCLA
highlights.details: Mathstodon post by mathematician Terence Tao addressing claims that his research was being suspended as part of a political crackdown at UCLA, shared to verify and contextualise rumors circulating online.

highlights.title: Nature article on a recent scientific development
highlights.details: A recent Nature article (2025) shared as context for earlier discussion; suitable as a reading for those following current debates in the relevant scientific field.

highlights.title: Bellodi & Lee report (DOGE_Bellodi_Lee.pdf)
highlights.details: Linked report hosted on lucabellodi.com, shared via a Bluesky post, cross-posted with a politics-related channel; relevant to quantitative political science or economics (exact topic not specified in the message).

highlights.title: Briefing Book piece on tougher immigration enforcement
highlights.details: Article by Ben Zipperer examining how stricter immigration enforcement policies affect broader economic or social outcomes, used as a cross-posted reference for politics and policy discussion.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab

channels.summary: Weekly server updates, promotion of Bellingcat investigations, Stage Talks, challenges, and calls for contributions across multiple investigative domains.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Mareike Vitt on funding OSINT projects
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk with Bellingcat’s fundraising lead Mareike Vitt about how to fund independent open-source research initiatives and ‘your own Bellingcat’.

highlights.title: Investigation into federal enforcement in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Update on Bellingcat’s work documenting 42 federal agent encounters in Washington, DC in under a month of federal control, including traffic stops escalating into detentions and workers pulled off mopeds.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Announcement and recording of a Stage Talk focused on identifying explosive ordnance and understanding EO use across conflicts, aimed at helping researchers safely and accurately classify munitions.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on the Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Recording link for a Stage Talk covering the Open Source Munitions Portal and how to use it for tracking and identifying weapons in conflict zones.

highlights.title: Bellingcat YouTube case study on decades-old murder
highlights.details: Video investigation by Bellingcat researcher Peter Barth showing how open-source methods can be used to investigate a decades-old murder case involving mafia, gamblers and pigeons.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenges platform
highlights.details: Announcement of new and ongoing OSINT challenges on Bellingcat’s challenge platform, encouraging members to solve geolocation and verification puzzles and share their methodology.

highlights.title: Investigation into sanctioned grain shipments from Crimea
highlights.details: Bellingcat and Lloyd’s List investigation revealing that Saudi Arabia imported grain directly from a sanctioned port in occupied Crimea via Russia’s ‘shadow fleet’.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with DoubleThinkLab on FIMI and inauthentic accounts
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk with Jasper Hewitt from DoubleThinkLab about monitoring inauthentic accounts and conducting Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference (FIMI) investigations.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Space4Good on satellite-based monitoring
highlights.details: Recap of a Stage Talk with Lisa Broekhuizen from Space4Good, exploring how satellite imagery and open-source methods can support environmental and social-good investigations.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment OSINT investigations
highlights.details: Merel announces that Bellingcat is looking for high-standard, open-source-based investigations into wildlife and environmental issues, inviting submissions from both journalists and non-journalists.

channels.summary: Light comments about possible OSINT tasks (Chinese airship/balloon sites and island comparison off Myanmar) without detailed analysis or shared resources.
Substantive sharing of open-source resources and news on cultural heritage trafficking, digitised archives, and shifts in US cultural property enforcement.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Library’s digitised Nuremberg Trials collection
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard Law School Library has put online the first complete, fully searchable English-language collection of evidentiary documents and trial transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, valuable for WWII-era provenance and restitution research.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated bust of cultural goods trafficking network
highlights.details: Europol press release on a coordinated operation led by Bulgarian authorities that dismantled a large criminal network trafficking cultural goods across Europe and beyond, including 35 arrests.

highlights.title: IFAR publications now freely accessible via Internet Archive
highlights.details: Announcement that the International Foundation for Art Research (IFAR)’s formerly paywalled publications have been digitised and made free on the Internet Archive, providing rich historical data for pre-digital art attribution and provenance research.

highlights.title: US disbands cultural property investigations unit
highlights.details: Denver Post article reporting that agents from Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program have been reassigned to immigration enforcement, weakening US leadership in cultural heritage investigations.

highlights.title: Europol and Bulgarian cultural goods trafficking case context
highlights.details: Additional commentary highlighting how heritage crime stories, such as a Spanish case involving bronze sculptures on loan to the Met Museum, often receive limited multilingual coverage despite their investigative importance.

highlights.title: BBC coverage related to art crime (topic unspecified)
highlights.details: A BBC News article shared as relevant to art crime and cultural heritage investigations; details of the case are not specified in the message but may involve recent developments in the field.

mentions: Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program

channels.summary: Discussion on Chinese politics and historical accountability plus a major news item on a Cambodian tycoon tied to scam operations, alongside debate over antisemitism and criticism of Israel.

highlights.title: NYT article on Chinese general linked to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: New York Times report on a Chinese general connected to the Tiananmen Square crackdown, relevant for understanding contemporary Chinese elite politics and historical memory.

highlights.title: Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi deported to China
highlights.details: The Standard article about Chen Zhi (Vincent Chen), head of Prince Holding Group, being deported to China amid allegations that his conglomerate profited from human trafficking tied to ‘pig-butchering’ scams and forced labor, with suspected fraud and money laundering totaling around US$10 billion.

channels.summary: Technical discussion of flight-tracking tools, safety investigations, and OSINT practices for following aircraft and air traffic communications.

highlights.title: CPA SkyCircles closest-approach visualisation
highlights.details: Example KML track loaded into CPA SkyCircles to visualise closest approaches between aircraft during a resolution advisory (RA), demonstrating how to enable position reports and inspect detailed encounter geometry.

highlights.title: TweetDeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: Ian Servin’s tutorial on building a TweetDeck-like web interface for monitoring multiple LiveATC audio feeds, useful for aviation OSINT and real-time incident monitoring.

highlights.title: BlueSky account tracking ICE aircraft via OSINT
highlights.details: Recommendation to follow a BlueSky account that systematically tracks US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) aircraft using publicly available flight data, illustrating applied aviation OSINT.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation on SpaceX launches and air safety
highlights.details: ProPublica article examining how SpaceX launches and the FAA’s oversight affect airline safety in Florida and the Caribbean, relevant for those tracking aerospace regulation and risk.

highlights.title: Preliminary NTSB report on UPS Flight 2976 crash
highlights.details: Link to the NTSB investigation page for the UPS Flight 2976 crash in Kentucky, providing official preliminary findings for further OSINT or safety analysis.

highlights.title: Using AirNav Radar and ADS-B Exchange for blocked flights
highlights.details: Tip describing how AirNav Radar (subscription) shows filed flight-plan routes for many flights, which, combined with ADS-B Exchange, allows investigators to infer origin and destination even for ‘blocked’ aircraft.

channels.summary: Link shared to an in-depth analysis of European ballistic missile warning capabilities, with a mod request for more descriptive link context.

highlights.title: IISS analysis on Europe and ballistic missile warning
highlights.details: International Institute for Strategic Studies article assessing European ballistic missile warning architecture and arguing there is significant room for improvement in space-based early-warning capabilities.

channels.summary: Resources shared on mapping Central Asian military infrastructure and news/analysis on Russian military moves and disinformation narratives in Armenia.

highlights.title: Oxus Society visualisation of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Interactive Oxus Society map showing military units in Tajikistan, useful for researchers mapping force structure in Central Asia.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Teaser about an almost-finished interactive dataset mapping more than 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan, indicating substantial forthcoming OSINT infrastructure for the region.

highlights.title: Euromaidan Press report on Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article detailing Moscow’s accelerated troop buildup in Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan, relevant for conflict monitoring in the South Caucasus.

highlights.title: Clarification on ‘initialed’ vs ‘signed’ peace deal in Caucasus context
highlights.details: Tweet (via fxtwitter mirror) used to clarify that a referenced peace agreement was ‘initialed’, not fully signed, highlighting the importance of precise treaty terminology in conflict analysis.

highlights.title: DFRLab biolabs narrative in Armenia
highlights.details: Summary from a DFRLab report (not directly linked) noting that the ‘biolabs’ disinformation narrative seen in Ukraine is being repurposed in Armenia, now implicating entities like CDC and USAID and even scientific conferences.

highlights.title: nkobserver post relevant to the region
highlights.details: An X (Twitter) post by @nkobserver shared as relevant for regional developments; specific content is not detailed in the message but is likely related to Nagorno-Karabakh or the wider Caucasus.

channels.summary: Channel saw confirmation of a completed geolocation for residential damage in Kherson oblast, with precise coordinates and source references.

highlights.title: Completed geolocation: Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson (ID 2547)
highlights.details: Member provided precise coordinates for two photos from a residential area in Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson, with a Google Maps satellite view link and original Telegram source for verification.

channels.summary: Meta channel activity focused on Bellingcat’s toolkit, Stage Talks, annual report, challenges, and recognition in journalism awards.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit one-year update
highlights.details: Reminder that the revamped Bellingcat Toolkit is a curated directory of open-source investigation tools with use cases, guidance, and reviews, maintained by volunteers.

highlights.title: Bellingcat 2024 Annual Report
highlights.details: Publication summarising Bellingcat’s 2024 investigations, impact, and lessons learned, useful for understanding the organisation’s strategy and casework.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on mapping Central Asia’s armed forces
highlights.details: Podcast episode featuring Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard on what ‘military power’ means and how mapping Central Asia’s armed forces and logistics can inform conflict analysis.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on far-right fashion
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk discussing how far-right movements use fashion and aesthetics, made available via the Stage Talks podcast feed.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on US immigration raids
highlights.details: Podcast episode covering Bellingcat’s investigation into US immigration raids, accessible via the Stage Talks feed, providing a case study in OSINT and accountability reporting.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Challenges portal
highlights.details: Direct link to Bellingcat’s challenge site where members can attempt OSINT puzzles and practice geolocation and verification skills.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp channel
highlights.details: Announcement of Bellingcat’s WhatsApp updates channel, offering an alternative way to receive investigation updates outside traditional social media platforms.

highlights.title: Patreon podcast episode on the Volunteer Community
highlights.details: Exclusive Patreon audio episode giving a behind-the-scenes look at Bellingcat’s volunteer community and how volunteer work is integrated into investigations.

highlights.title: Award recognition for open-source extremist identifications
highlights.details: Post congratulating Bellingcat contributors for recognition in journalism awards for their open-source extremist identifications work, with link to the awards listing.

channels.summary: Focused sharing of examples of influence operations and research on why people embrace misinformation, plus a debunk of fabricated FBI letters.

highlights.title: GDIT Danish linguist job likely tied to SOCOM info ops
highlights.details: Job listing for a Danish linguist at General Dynamics Information Technology assessed as likely supporting US SOCOM information operations targeting Danish media and Greenlandic audiences.

highlights.title: Ars Technica article on psychological rewards of misinformation
highlights.details: Ars Technica piece discussing research that shows believing misinformation can be subjectively rewarding for some people even when it is disproven, helping explain the persistence of false beliefs.

highlights.title: Needle News debunk of alleged FBI letters
highlights.details: Article explaining that a set of alleged FBI letters are fake, providing documentation for debunking a circulating disinformation artifact.

channels.summary: High-volume sharing of environmental journalism, climate and water-security research, deforestation tools, and training resources, with some community moderation reminders.

highlights.title: Guardian article on mosquitoes in Iceland and climate change
highlights.details: Guardian report on mosquitoes being found in Iceland for the first time, framed as evidence of how the climate crisis is altering ecosystems and species distributions.

highlights.title: Washington Post on US dams sinking and associated risks
highlights.details: Washington Post investigation into subsidence and structural risks affecting US dams, with an archived copy shared for preservation and easier access.

highlights.title: YouTube short on menu changes cutting canteen carbon footprint
highlights.details: Short video demonstrating how swapping dishes in a canteen’s weekly menu led to a 30% reduction in the carbon footprint of meals, providing an easily shareable example of behavioral climate mitigation.

highlights.title: Retraction of seminal glyphosate safety paper
highlights.details: Mastodon post highlighting that a key paper long used to justify glyphosate’s safety has been retracted, with concerns over authorship and validity, significantly impacting debates on pesticide risk.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas deforestation monitoring site
highlights.details: Online platform for visualising deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei Darussalam, Papua New Guinea and Colombia, recommended as a useful tool for environmental OSINT.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Jupyter notebook tutorials
highlights.details: Copernicus marine service’s Jupyter notebook-based e-learning materials for environmental monitoring and analysis, useful for those wanting to apply satellite and model data in OSINT investigations.

highlights.title: Nature article on an environmental topic
highlights.details: Recent Nature article shared as relevant to environmental and climate discussions in the channel (exact subject not specified in the message).

highlights.title: Grist article on Miccosukee Tribe and Alligator Alcatraz land
highlights.details: Grist piece about how the Miccosukee Tribe blocked the Alligator Alcatraz development and how a subsequent bill to return their land was blocked by Trump, connecting environmental justice and Indigenous rights.

highlights.title: Blue Origin wastewater impact on Indian River Lagoon
highlights.details: Local news report on how Blue Origin’s wastewater discharges may be affecting Florida’s Indian River Lagoon ecosystem.

highlights.title: Inside Climate News on suppression of environmental journalism in Africa
highlights.details: Article examining how China is constraining environmental journalism in African contexts, with implications for transparency around overseas projects and ecological harms.

highlights.title: UNU-INWEH report on global water bankruptcy
highlights.details: UNU-INWEH analysis warning that the world is entering an era of ‘global water bankruptcy’, offering data and framing for discussions on water scarcity and governance.
